intro: Tithymalus pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf tithymalus, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to mountainous regions in Europe, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, making it a low-growing ground cover. It is often found in rocky or shaded areas, where it forms dense mats.
